files.text:
'Files' in pysocial are individual graphs - though all of the node and connection data are stored in the same database, each node is associated with a 'file'.

In order to work on a graph, you need to open the relevant file with the `open <file>` command.

To see a list of all files, use the `listfiles` command.

To render a graph from a file, open it and then use the `render` command.

aliases.text: Aliases for the 'exit' command are: x

open.text:
Opens a file in the database
Syntax: `open <file>`

aliases.text: Aliases for the 'open' command are: o

listnodes.text:
Lists all nodes in the current file, or in the entire database if no files are open
Syntax: `listnodes`

aliases.text: Aliases for the 'listnodes' command are: ln

listfiles.text:
Lists all files in the database
Syntax: `listfiles`

aliases.text: Aliases for the 'listfiles' command are: lf

add.text:
Adds a node or group of nodes to the network
Syntax: `add <node> [additional nodes]`

naming.text: Node names can consist of multiple characters - surround multi-character names with single-quotes, or use \ to escape the spaces. Also use \ to escape semicolon (;) characters.

aliases.text: Aliases for the 'add' command are: a

render.text:
Renders a graph as an image file
Syntax: `render [path]`

Note that the [path] parameter is optional - it defaults to `render_output.png`

aliases.text: Aliases for the 'render' command are: r
